ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
numpy:
- '2'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
BoltzTraP2 is a modern implementation of the smoothed Fourier
interpolation algorithm for electronic bands that formed the base of
the original and widely used BoltzTraP code. One of the most typical
uses of BoltzTraP is the calculation of thermoelectric transport
coefficients as functions of temperature and chemical potential in
the rigid-band picture. However, many other features are available,
including 3D plots of Fermi surfaces based on the reconstructed bands.
about.summary: Boltzmann Transport Properties (BoltzTraP) is a program for calculating the semi-classic transport coefficients

BoltzTraP2 is a modern implementation of the smoothed Fourier

about.summary: Boltzmann Transport Properties (BoltzTraP) is a program for calculating the semi-classic transport coefficients

name: boltztrap2

about.description:
BoltzTraP2 is a modern implementation of the smoothed Fourier
interpolation algorithm for electronic bands that formed the base of
the original and widely used BoltzTraP code. One of the most typical
uses of BoltzTraP is the calculation of thermoelectric transport
coefficients as functions of temperature and chemical potential in
the rigid-band picture. However, many other features are available,
including 3D plots of Fermi surfaces based on the reconstructed bands.
about.summary: Boltzmann Transport Properties (BoltzTraP) is a program for calculating the semi-classic transport coefficients

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "BoltzTraP2" %}
{% set version = "25.11.1" %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name | lower }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 1a5493cdc9a9d834f1f33f7efad89896e3f8a3f8e36eee0c1699f41d5666234a
  patches:
    - spglib.patch

build:
  number: 0
  skip: true  # [win]
  entry_points:
    - btp2 = BoltzTraP2.interface:btp2_main
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - cython
  host:
    - pip
    - python
    - cython
    - spglib
    - eigen
    - numpy
    - packaging
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python
    - {{ pin_compatible('numpy') }}
    - scipy
    - matplotlib-base
    - ase
    - netcdf4
    - cython

test:
  imports:
    - BoltzTraP2
  commands:
    - pip check
    - btp2 dope -h
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://www.imc.tuwien.ac.at/forschungsbereich_theoretische_chemie/forschungsgruppen/prof_dr_gkh_madsen_theoretical_materials_chemistry/boltztrap/
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: Boltzmann Transport Properties (BoltzTraP) is a program for calculating the semi-classic transport coefficients
  description: |
    BoltzTraP2 is a modern implementation of the smoothed Fourier
    interpolation algorithm for electronic bands that formed the base of 
    the original and widely used BoltzTraP code. One of the most typical
    uses of BoltzTraP is the calculation of thermoelectric transport
    coefficients as functions of temperature and chemical potential in
    the rigid-band picture. However, many other features are available,
    including 3D plots of Fermi surfaces based on the reconstructed bands.
  doc_url: https://gitlab.com/sousaw/BoltzTraP2/
  dev_url: https://gitlab.com/sousaw/BoltzTraP2/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jan-janssen
